summary: This is an email from an FBI agent informing colleagues about travel to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment. The email coordinates investigative efforts between New York and Jacksonville areas of responsibility.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Author of the email, notifying recipients about travel to Florida to interview victims in the Epstein case. He is part of Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking in the FBI New York office.

events.title: FBI travel to Florida for victim interviews
events.description: FBI agents from New York travel to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Epstein's arrest and indictment.

events.title: Start of victim interviews in Florida
events.description: FBI agents plan to begin interviewing victims in the Miami/West Palm Beach area and Palm Coast.

keyFacts: The FBI was mobilizing to interview approximately 25 victims in Florida following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment.
Most victims were located in the Miami/West Palm Beach area, with one victim in Palm Coast.
The email demonstrates coordination between FBI offices (New York and Jacksonville AOR) in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's arrest.
The investigative team was part of Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking cases.
The travel was planned to begin immediately, with agents flying down on July 9, 2019, and starting interviews the next day.
